revised_title: Electrogenic Sodium Pump in Pancreatic Acinar Cells: A New Discovery
tldr: The authors discovered that pancreatic acinar cells have an electrogenic sodium pump that is dependent on the presence of extracellular potassium and sensitive to strophanthin-G. This finding indicates that the sodium pump plays a significant role in the membrane potential of these cells and contributes to their function.
